    • Method Detail

      • searching

        public static java.util.List<ir.apache.lucene.SearchResultData> searching(java.nio.file.Path indexPath,

                                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Executes Search using a specified Index by calling doPagingSearch(....) internally
        Parameters:
        indexPath - Path to document folder
        queryString - query string to search in index files
        Returns:
        searchResultDataList List of search results
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there is any Exception

      • doPagingSearch

        public static java.util.List<ir.apache.lucene.SearchResultData> doPagingSearch(java.io.BufferedReader in,
                                                                               org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher searcher,
                                                                               org.apache.lucene.search.Query query,
                                                                               int hitsPerPage,
                                                                               boolean interactive)
                                                                        throws java.io.IOException
        This demonstrates a typical paging search scenario, where the search engine presents pages of size n to the user. The user can then go to the next page if interested in the next hits. When the query is executed for the first time, then only enough results are collected to fill 5 result pages. If the user wants to page beyond this limit, then the query is executed another time and all hits are collected.
        Parameters:
        in - BufferedReader to read input given
        searcher - To search through indexed documents
        query - Search query
        hitsPerPage - Number of results to be displayed at once
        interactive - Check if there is any input
        Returns:
        searchResultDataList List of search results
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there is a low-level I/O error
